summary: This is an email chain from July 2020 discussing updates to a public website regarding the Ghislaine Maxwell case. It references a July 2019 hearing where Maxwell was arraigned, pleaded not guilty, was ordered detained pending trial, and a trial date was set for July 2021 before Judge Alison J. Nathan.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. She entered a plea of not guilty to the Superseding Indictment and was ordered incarcerated pending trial.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the Maxwell case, scheduled to hold the trial at the Thurgood Marshall United States Courthouse.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in reference to a previous case box on the website that needs to be changed to focus on the Maxwell case.

connections.description: Implicitly connected as the website update involves changing a case heading from 'Jeffrey Epstein' to 'Ghislaine Maxwell', indicating their cases are related.
Judge Nathan is presiding over Maxwell's criminal case, setting deadlines and the trial date.

events.title: Maxwell Arraignment and Bail Hearing
events.description: An arraignment, initial conference, and bail hearing were held for Ghislaine Maxwell. She pleaded not guilty to the Superseding Indictment and the court ordered her incarcerated pending trial.

events.title: Scheduled Trial Date for Maxwell
events.description: The court scheduled a trial date for July 12, 2021, before Judge Alison J. Nathan.

locations: Thurgood Marshall United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, New York, New York
keyFacts: On July 14, 2019, Ghislaine Maxwell pleaded not guilty to a Superseding Indictment and was ordered detained pending trial.
The trial for Ghislaine Maxwell was scheduled for July 12, 2021, before Judge Alison J. Nathan in the Southern District of New York.
The document is an internal email from July 2020 coordinating an update to a public website to shift focus from the 'Epstein case' to the 'Maxwell case'.
The case reference is United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (MN).
The email indicates the public was directed to a website for updates and to provide information regarding the Maxwell case.
